message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.DS. 

The paper proposes a novel method for binary classification using a perceptron and extensively compares it with other methods on benchmark datasets. This suggests that the paper belongs to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The use of features based on subsampling and locality suggests that the paper may also belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The use of a regularized pseudoinverse to determine the weights of the output layer suggests that the paper may also belong to the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the use of Chebichev inequality to characterize the confidence measure suggests that the paper may also belong to the data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category.
